item.title: Baby making skill
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“twins, post:19, topic:534261”]1. Be a male.
2. Right click a female.
3. choose “mate”.
4. Wait 9 months.
5. Tada you made a baby and received 15k exp.

At level 20 you can make 2 babies with 2 players(female players)
At level 30 you can make 3 babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 40 you can make 8 babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 50 you can make 10babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 60 you can make 15babies with 4 players(female players)
At level 70 you can make 20 babies with 4 players(female players)
At level 80 you can make 25 babies with 5 players(female players)
At level 90 you can make 30 babies with 5 players(female players)

At level 99 you can right click a female demon and make demon babys.[/quote]
great idea, but there has to be some sort of challenge. clicking mate is too easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Baby making skill
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

  1. Be a male.
  2. Right click a female.
  3. choose “mate”.
  4. Wait 9 months.
  5. Tada you made a baby and received 15k exp.

At level 20 you can make 2 babies with 2 players(female players)
At level 30 you can make 3 babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 40 you can make 8 babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 50 you can make 10babies with 3 players(female players)
At level 60 you can make 15babies with 4 players(female players)
At level 70 you can make 20 babies with 4 players(female players)
At level 80 you can make 25 babies with 5 players(female players)
At level 90 you can make 30 babies with 5 players(female players)

At level 99 you can right click a female demon and make demon babys.

item.title: Baby making skill
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

After reaching 4 hours of nourishment, the teenager moves away from chores and runs errands that can take up to an hour of log-in time. These jobs can consist of gathering a needle from the nearest general store, retrieving a resource from your bank, or creating an item with provided resources (of course proportional to your current levels that meet minimum requirements to create an item i.e smithing and mining). Once the teenager returns, you must pay the teenager based off of a formula: (resource store price / time gone[minutes]) * parenting level.

Read full topic

item.title: Baby making skill
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:5, topic:534261”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=653059.msg4376018#msg4376018 date=1382061539]
Nice start, but how about the teenager could do gathering for you in exchange for money (like chores) for a certain period of time, eventually the grown kid wanders off. You could have a random set of locations where your kid could end up (your kid will say I’m moving to Varrock thank you for being a great parent!) later on when you find your kid perhaps they could send you on a quest or you could go on a quest with them.
[/quote]
Great, now I have to continue.
The teenager could act as a experience gained/time used sort of bonus. You could send the teenager to cut x amount of logs, and after he runs out of “chore energy” (depending on his age; increases by 20% every hour of nurturing) you gain 50% of the experience you would have gained. Alternatively, you could use nourishment resources that fill up the teenager’s “chore energy” meter to retrieve a set amount of resources for you, an while you gain the resources, no experience is rewarded other than in the (changing the name here) parenting skill.[/quote]

Why have chore energy? My chores consist of (I don’t have chores, but when I did) do this and that and that, there was no “I’m tired, sorry dad.” So you give a set of tasks, which are basic gathering techniques, you cannot give the child the same task more than once in a day and as your child’s experience gains in the chore he is doing over time he gets better and more efficient, therefore bringing in more product and in return more money for the chores. So he could leave after he earns a set amount of money for doing chores. Maybe he could have a job on top of chores, so you can’t give him tasks when he is “at work” the child has to pay you x amount of GP per month (not a real month obviously) to keep living with you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Nice start, but how about the teenager could do gathering for you in exchange for money (like chores) for a certain period of time, eventually the grown kid wanders off. You could have a random set of locations where your kid could end up (your kid will say I’m moving to Varrock thank you for being a great parent!) later on when you find your kid perhaps they could send you on a quest or you could go on a quest with them.

Great, now I have to continue.
The teenager could act as a experience gained/time used sort of bonus. You could send the teenager to cut x amount of logs, and after he runs out of “chore energy” (depending on his age; increases by 20% every hour of nurturing) you gain 50% of the experience you would have gained. Alternatively, you could use nourishment resources that fill up the teenager’s “chore energy” meter to retrieve a set amount of resources for you, and while you gain the resources, no experience is rewarded other than in the (changing the name here) parenting skill.

item.title: Baby making skill
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

arham 4:

Cutscene.

Oh my.

As for features, perhaps have the player embark on a journey to collect items such as a pacifier, diapers, baby powder, and the elixir of patience. At the end of the quest, the player does the “rofl” emote (which could also be seen as rolling in pain), and a baby pops into the player’s inventory. The player would need to nurture the baby, and after 5 continuous hours of nurturing, the then-teenaged child wanders away. Repeat for new babies.

Read full topic
